intro.title: Calculate Your Take-Home Pay
intro.description: Understanding the difference between gross and net salary is crucial for financial planning. Our calculator shows exactly how much you'll take home after federal, state, and FICA taxes.
features: Calculate net salary from gross earnings
Account for federal and state income taxes

faqs.question: What's the difference between gross and net salary?
faqs.answer: Gross salary is your total earnings before any deductions. Net salary is what you actually receive after taxes and withholdings are subtracted.

faqs.question: What taxes are included in the calculation?
faqs.answer: We include federal income tax, FICA taxes (Social Security and Medicare), and state income tax. Local taxes and other deductions may apply.

faqs.question: Are these calculations guaranteed to be accurate?
faqs.answer: These are estimates based on current tax rates. Actual amounts may vary based on your specific tax situation and additional deductions.

faqs.question: How often should I recalculate?
faqs.answer: Recalculate when tax rates change, your income changes, or when considering new job offers. Tax laws are updated annually.

tips: Use this calculator when comparing job offers
Consider your tax bracket when negotiating salary
Remember that bonuses and overtime are taxed differently
Consult a tax professional for personalized advice
